titleStmt.title: Shadrach Walters to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG6399

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Paintsville Johnson Co
Kentucky 30th May 1865
To His Excellency
Governer Bramlett

your Petitioner Shadrach Walters would represent that in 1861 he was licenced as a merchant to retail ardent spirits and that he sold some whisky by the Quart to two individuals who was directed by your petitioner and who promised they would take the same off of the premises and adjacent premises before they would use or drink the same and in violation of your Petitioners orders and their promise did drink some of the whiskey on the Premises adjacent to the place where sold and then endicted this petitioner in two cases before the Grand Jury of Johnson County for Tipling He says at this term of the Johnson circuit Court he was fined $20 in each Case he prays your excellency to remit said fines and in duty will ever pray
We the undersigned have heard the foregoing Petition and believe the statements therein are true and hope your Excellency will remit said fines

very truly yours
J. S. Dury
Comth Atty.

P. S. Direct to John M. Burns
Catlettsburg Ky

Hon Thomas E.. Bramlitt
Frankfort
Kentucky

Johnson Cir Ct
vs
Shaddrach Walters
2 judgts $20 each
24th June 1865
Remit as the atty for Comth recommends it --
